page.title: 16SATURDAYS IN EXMOUTH
page.content: On Saturdays I wake up at about 10 o'clock, get dressed and have my breakfast, usually toast but no drink. There are four of us in our family and we own a Guest House called Devonia in St. Andrews Road. We have four residents who stay with us all the year round and a visitor who is staying with us for two weeks, so we are full. Sometimes Mum and I walk into town. She might buy me a 'teebag' teeshirt (with mesh at the top) and a pencil skirt (straight with two pleats at the sides). All together they cost about twenty pounds. I go to my friends house for tea. We have mince, cabbage and roast potatoes. We play Jet Set Willy on the computer until 8 p.m. We argue and giggle until midnight.
